title: How to Show Invisibles & Formatting Marks in Google Docs

steps.title: Go to https://docs.google.com/document and log in.
steps.content: Go to https://docs.google.com/document and log in. You can only see invisible characters when using Google Docs in a web browser on your computer. This won't work in the mobile app.

steps.title: Open an existing document or start a new one.
steps.content: Open an existing document or start a new one. Click the multicolored plus sign to create a new document, or click one you already have to open.

steps.title: Click the View tab.
steps.content: Click the View tab. It's at the top of your document.

steps.title: Click Show non-printing characters.
steps.content: Click Show non-printing characters . Alternatively, press Ctrl + Shift + P (PC) or Cmd + Shift + P (Mac) to instantly show hidden paragraph markers, line breaks, section breaks, column breaks, tabs, and spaces. [2] X Research source To hide these characters again, return to View and select Show non-printing characters or press the keyboard shortcut again.
